com.appboy.models

Interface IInAppMessage

  • All Superinterfaces:
    IPutIntoJson<org.json.JSONObject>
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    IInAppMessageHtml, IInAppMessageImmersive
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    InAppMessageBase, InAppMessageControl, InAppMessageFull, InAppMessageHtmlBase, InAppMessageHtmlFull, InAppMessageImmersiveBase, InAppMessageModal, InAppMessageSlideup

    public interface IInAppMessage
extends IPutIntoJson<org.json.JSONObject>
    InAppMessageBase is the base model interface for all in-app messages. It implicitly defines policy for in-app message fields that can be changed from outside the object. All Known Implementing Classes: InAppMessageBase InAppMessageSlideup All Known Subinterfaces: IInAppMessageHtml IInAppMessageImmersive

      • getImageDownloadSuccessful

        boolean getImageDownloadSuccessful()
        Returns the status of the image download on this in-app message. If the image specified by getRemoteImageUrl() could not be downloaded successfully then this should return false. Returns false by default.
        Returns:
        true if the image was downloaded successfully

      • getRemoteAssetPathForPrefetch

        java.lang.String getRemoteAssetPathForPrefetch()
        Returns a path to remote assets that can be pre-fetched. To point this in-app message to pre-fetched assets, use setLocalAssetPathForPrefetch(String)
        Returns:
        a path to a remote asset that could be pre-fetched.

      • getOrientation

        Orientation getOrientation()
        Gets the preferred screen orientation for this in-app message. In-app messages will only display if the preferred orientation matches the current activity orientation. However, there is an important exception for tablets For in-app messages that have a preferred orientation and are being displayed on tablet, the in-app message will appear in the style of the preferred orientation regardless of actual screen orientation.
        Returns:
        the preferred screen orientation for this in-app message

      • getCropType

        CropType getCropType()
        Gets the crop type for this in-app message's image.
        Returns:
        the image crop type for this in-app message's image.

      • getMessageTextAlign

        TextAlign getMessageTextAlign()
        Get the text alignment for the message text.
        Returns:
        the text alignment for the message text

      • getExpirationTimestamp

        long getExpirationTimestamp()
        Get the UTC timestamp at which this message expires and will not be displayed.
        Returns:
        the expiration timestamp for the message

      • getOpenUriInWebView

        boolean getOpenUriInWebView()
        Whether to use AppboyWebViewActivity to open deep links from this in-app message. When true, the SDK will make a best effort to use AppboyWebViewActivity to open the deep link. When false, deep links are opened using an Intent.ACTION_VIEW intent. See setOpenUriInWebView(boolean)
        Returns:
        true if AppboyWebViewActivity should be used to open deep links from this in-app message.

      • setOpenUriInWebView

        void setOpenUriInWebView(boolean openUriInWebView)
        Sets whether to use AppboyWebViewActivity to open deep links from this in-app message. See getOpenUriInWebView()
        Parameters:
        openUriInWebView - whether AppboyWebViewActivity should be used to open deep links from this in-app message.

      • setExpirationTimestamp

        void setExpirationTimestamp(long expirationTimestamp)
        Set the UTC timestamp at which this message expires and will not be displayed.
        Parameters:
        expirationTimestamp - expiration timestamp for the message

      • setMessageTextAlign

        void setMessageTextAlign(TextAlign textAlign)
        Set the text alignment for the message text.
        Parameters:

        Sets the crop type for this in-app message's image.
        Parameters:
        cropType - the image crop type for this in-app message's image.

      • setOrientation

        void setOrientation(Orientation orientation)
        Sets the preferred screen orientation for this in-app message. In-app messages will only display if the preferred orientation matches the current activity orientation. However, there is an important exception for tablets For in-app messages that have a preferred orientation and are being displayed on tablet, the in-app message will appear in the style of the preferred orientation regardless of actual screen orientation.
        Parameters:
        orientation - the preferred screen orientation for this in-app message

      • setMessage

        void setMessage(java.lang.String message)
        Sets the message text of this in-app message.
        Parameters:
        message - the desired message text for this in-app message.

      • setAnimateIn

        void setAnimateIn(boolean animateIn)
        Sets whether this in-app message will animate in or appear suddenly. The recommended default is true.
        Parameters:
        animateIn - whether to animate the in-app message in.

      • setAnimateOut

        void setAnimateOut(boolean animateOut)
        Sets whether this in-app message will animate out or disappear suddenly. The recommended default is true.
        Parameters:
        animateOut - whether to animate the in-app message out.

      • setClickAction

        boolean setClickAction(ClickAction clickAction)
        Sets the click action of this in-app message. See ClickAction
        Parameters:
        clickAction - The desired click action.
        Returns:
        true if the click action was successfully set.

      • setClickAction

        boolean setClickAction(ClickAction clickAction,
                       android.net.Uri uri)
        Sets the click action of this in-app message. See ClickAction
        Parameters:
        clickAction - The desired click action.
        uri - A valid Uri to navigate to on click. To set the Uri, the click action must be set to URI and a non-null Uri must be specified.
        Returns:
        true if the click action was successfully set.

      • setDismissType

        void setDismissType(DismissType dismissType)
        Sets the dismiss type of this in-app message. See DismissType
        Parameters:
        dismissType - Desired dismiss type.

      • setDurationInMilliseconds

        void setDurationInMilliseconds(int durationInMilliseconds)
        Sets the duration of this in-app message.
        Parameters:
        durationInMilliseconds - Desired in-app message duration. Inappropriately low or high values should be set to a reasonable default.

      • setBackgroundColor

        void setBackgroundColor(int backgroundColor)
        Sets the background color on this in-app message.
        Parameters:
        backgroundColor - See Color

      • setIconBackgroundColor

        void setIconBackgroundColor(int iconColor)
        Sets the icon background color on this in-app message. This will set the color of the icon background itself (not the icon itself). See setIconColor(int)
        Parameters:
        iconColor - See Color

      • setIconColor

        void setIconColor(int iconColor)
        Sets the icon color on this in-app message. This will set the color of the icon itself (not the background). See setIconBackgroundColor(int)
        Parameters:
        iconColor - See Color

      • setMessageTextColor

        void setMessageTextColor(int textColor)
        Sets the message text color on this in-app message.
        Parameters:
        textColor - See Color

      • setIcon

        void setIcon(java.lang.String icon)
        Sets the icon on this in-app message.
        Parameters:
        icon - Unicode string for the desired Font Awesome icon.

      • setImageUrl

        void setImageUrl(java.lang.String imageUrl)
        Sets the image on this in-app message to a remote uri. If a bitmap and image url are both set, the bitmap will be prioritized. If using Fresco, use setRemoteImageUrl(String) instead as Fresco does not use bitmaps directly. Local uris will be prioritized over remote uris. To set a local uri, use setLocalImageUrl(String) See setBitmap(android.graphics.Bitmap) Equivalent to calling setRemoteImageUrl(String).
        Parameters:
        imageUrl - Url for the desired image.

      • setRemoteImageUrl

        void setRemoteImageUrl(java.lang.String imageUrl)
        Sets the image on this in-app message to a remote uri. If a bitmap and remote image url are both set, the bitmap will be prioritized. If using Fresco, use this method instead as Fresco does not use bitmaps directly. Local uris will be prioritized over remote uris. To set a local uri, use setLocalImageUrl(String) See setBitmap(android.graphics.Bitmap)
        Parameters:
        imageUrl - Url for the desired image.

      • setLocalImageUrl

        void setLocalImageUrl(java.lang.String imageUrl)
        Sets the image on this in-app message to a local uri. If a bitmap and local image url are both set, the bitmap will be prioritized. If using Fresco, use this method instead as Fresco does not use bitmaps directly. Local uris will be prioritized over remote uris. To set a remote uri, use setRemoteImageUrl(String) See setBitmap(android.graphics.Bitmap)
        Parameters:
        imageUrl - Url for the desired image.

      • setLocalAssetPathForPrefetch

        void setLocalAssetPathForPrefetch(java.lang.String localUri)
        Instruct this in-app message where to find pre-fetched assets for remote assets specified in getRemoteAssetPathForPrefetch()
        Parameters:
        localUri - Uri for the pre-fetched local asset.

      • setBitmap

        void setBitmap(android.graphics.Bitmap bitmap)
        Explicitly sets the bitmap on this in-app message. If a bitmap and image url are both set, the bitmap will be prioritized. If using Fresco, use setRemoteImageUrl(String) or setLocalImageUrl(String) instead as Fresco does not use bitmaps directly. See setLocalImageUrl(String) See setRemoteImageUrl(String)
        Parameters:
        bitmap - An optimized bitmap image.

      • setImageDownloadSuccessful

        void setImageDownloadSuccessful(boolean imageDownloadSuccessful)
        Sets the status of the image download on this in-app message. See getImageDownloadSuccessful(). See getImageDownloadSuccessful().
        Parameters:
        imageDownloadSuccessful - value for the success of the image download

      • logImpression

        boolean logImpression()
        Logs an impression on this in-app message. Impressions may only be logged once per in-app message instance. See logClick()
        Returns:
        true iff the impression was successfully logged.

      • logClick

        boolean logClick()
        Logs a click on this in-app message. Clicks may only be logged once per in-app message instance. See logImpression()
        Returns:
        true iff the click was successfully logged.

      • logDisplayFailure

        boolean logDisplayFailure(InAppMessageFailureType failureType)
        Logs a display failure on this in-app message. Failures can only be logged once per in-app message instance and should be logged as early as possible in the display process. In-app message display failures may affect campaign statistics so care should be taken when logging display failures.
        Parameters:
        failureType - The precise type of the display failure.
        Returns:
        true if the display failure was successfully logged.

      • onAfterClosed

        void onAfterClosed()
        Should be called on the in-app message once it is no longer being displayed, to allow it to perform any cleanup or trigger further actions.

      • isControl

        boolean isControl()
        Gets whether this in-app message is a control for multivariate testing. Control in-app messages should not be displayed to users.
        Returns:
        whether this in-app message is a control.
